audio_description: Hello and welcome friends! Today we are going to make a basic mutton biryani — Kerala-style Thalassery mutton biryani. Let's see how to make this super simple Thalassery biryani.

audio_description: After the mutton is well mixed, add about six glasses of water, because we need the mutton to cook properly. Close the cooker and cook it for 4–5 whistles. The mutton should be about 80–90% cooked.

audio_description: Look at our mutton — super soft, juicy, and well-cooked. We cooked 80–90% of it in the cooker, and the remaining 10% was done in dum. That’s why it’s so soft and flavorful.
